questions.question: 👋 Select your gender
options: 👨 Male
👩 Female
🧑 Other

questions.question: ⏳ Select your age
options: 55 & older

questions.question: 🤔 What would you like to achieve with us?
options: 💳 Break the cycle of debt
🛍️ Stop overspending
🌱 Grow your savings steadily
🚫 Quit bad financial habits
📚 Learn about personal finance
🏡 Save for the future
🎯 Achieve a financial goal
🔒 Gain financial security

questions.question: 💭 How do you feel about your money today?
options: 😟 I’m constantly stressed and am just trying to keep up
😕 I’m tired of the ups and downs, like I’m getting nowhere
😐 I’m managing okay, but it’s still a lot to handle.
🙂 I’m seeing improvements, and things seem manageable
😊 I’m feeling quite steady, but there’s still room to grow
😄 I feel stable and confident about where I’m headed.

questions.question: We got your back
options: Achieve your goals smoothly and confidently with our interactive, hands-on program. Simple steps, real results—let’s create your best financial future together!

questions.question: 💪 What financial skills would you like to improve, first of all?
options: 💡 Making smarter money decisions every day
🧘‍♂️ Handling unexpected financial challenges with confidence
🏡 Planning ahead for big expenses and future goals
💰 Saving consistently without giving up what you enjoy
📊 Balancing spending and saving effectively
🚀 Finding ways to build and grow your wealth
🔎 Learning to handle day-to-day finances with less stress

questions.question: ⏰ When do you like to learn?
options: ☕ After morning coffee
🍕 During the lunch break
🛏 Before going to sleep
🎲 Any spare time

questions.question: 📚 How do you feel about learning in general?
options: 😍 I love it—learning excites and motivates me
🙂 I enjoy it when it’s useful and engaging
😟 It feels like a chore most of the time
😩 I avoid it whenever I can

questions.question: Develop your financial skills and have fun
options: This course is nothing like reading long books or watching hours-long videos. Divided into bite-sized pieces, it gives you direction, inspiration, and practical tools to start a completely new financial chapter—all while enjoying the process.

questions.question: 💸 How do everyday financial tasks like paying bills or tracking spending make you feel?
options: 😟 Overwhelmed by bills and expenses, often avoiding them
😬 Stressed about payments but still trying to manage
🤔 Unsure about how to manage daily finances correctly
😌 Calm with tasks like paying bills—it's just a routine
😊 Confident, having a solid system for bills and expenses

questions.question: 🎉 How do you feel about great deals and discounts?
options: 😍 I absolutely love great deals and never miss a chance to grab one.
😉 I’m tempted by discounts but try to stay mindful about spending.
😐 I’m indifferent to deals and don’t pay much attention to them.
😟 I avoid great deals and discounts because they often lead to overspending.

questions.question: 💭 When you think about your financial future, how do you feel?
options: 😟 Stressed. I feel like it’s too late or too hard to change things
😨 Scared. There's too much uncertainty and anxiety
😶 Detached. I just avoid thinking about it
😊 Confident. I’m sure I’ll make progress and figure things out
💪 Hopeful. I believe things will get better with the right steps
🤔 Curious. I’m eager to learn and take my next steps

questions.question: ✨ Are there things you enjoy about your financial life?
options: 😩 No, it’s overwhelming and hard to manage
😟 Not really—it feels like more stress than anything else
😐 Not sure—I haven’t thought much about it
🙂 Sometimes—small wins make me happy
😊 I try to enjoy it, but it’s not easy
😍 Yes, I love feeling in control and reaching my goals

questions.question: You've gained a lot of experience by now
options: Today, it’s time to gather all those valuable lessons—and step confidently into a new chapter of your financial journey. With every step forward, you’re creating the life you’ve dreamed of. Let’s make it happen!

questions.question: 💪 Do you believe that trying new approaches and learning from mistakes leads to financial success?
options: 👍 Strongly agree
👍 Agree
🤷 Not sure
👎 Disagree
👎 Strongly disagree

questions.question: 🤔 Do you agree with this statement? 'Sometimes I need a little push to keep going. Otherwise, I might stop when things feel overwhelming.'
options: 👍 Strongly agree
👍 Agree
🤷 Not sure
👎 Disagree
👎 Strongly disagree

questions.question: Build practical skills
options: This isn’t just a “financial literacy” course. Every step you take—no matter how small—lays the foundation for your upcoming financial success. And we’re here to make sure you enjoy every moment of the journey.

questions.question: 🔍 Where do you usually look for answers when you don’t understand something?
options: 📸 Social media
🇬 Google
▶️   YouTube
🌀 ChatGPT
📚 Books
💬 Internet forums
📜 Academic articles
🔮 Other
👥 Friends or colleagues

questions.question: 👋️ Excellent choice! What should we call you?
📝 Which way is the most effective for you to learn new things?
options: 🥊 Starting with practice and learning along the way
📖 First theory, then practice
😉 Depends on the subject

questions.question: 🎛 Do you consider yourself a multitasker?
options: 👍 Strongly agree
👍 Agree
🤷 Not sure
👎 Disagree
👎 Strongly disagree

questions.question: Learn smarter, not harder
options: In just 10 minutes, you’ll uncover simple, practical steps to make managing your finances less stressful and more empowering—clear, actionable, and designed to fit where you are today.

questions.question: 💭 How well do you know your monthly expenses?
options: 🧾 I track every detail and know where all my money goes
🧐 I know my monthly expenses roughly, but not in detail
🤷‍♂️ I often wonder where my money disappears each month
😴 I don’t think about my monthly expenses at all

questions.question: 🛍 How often do you think about whether a purchase is necessary or not?
options: ✅ Always. I evaluate every expense carefully.
😊 I think mostly about making a major purchase.
🤔 I mostly buy what feels right at the moment.
🤩 If I want something that I can afford, I just go and buy it.

questions.question: 💳 How would you describe your debt situation?
options: 💪 I’m debt-free—it’s not a problem for me
😊 It’s under control. I have a debt paying plan and stick to it
🤯 I have debt, but I'm doing my best to figure it out
🔍 I don’t really know—I avoid looking at it
😟 It’s overwhelming—I feel stuck in debt

questions.question: 🛠 If an emergency came up today, how would you manage?
options: 💪 I have enough savings to cover any emergency expenses
🤷‍♀️ I could manage an emergency, but it would be tight
💰 I would need to borrow money or delay payments
😟 I just can’t handle an emergency if it came up today
🔄 I’m trying to save for emergencies but I'm not there yet

questions.question: 34% of all Americans have $0 in savings
options: Also, the majority has significant debt. So, if you are in this situation, you're not alone. The good news is, there's always a way to get out of debt and start building the stress-free future you truly deserve. Let's do it together!

questions.question: 🛠 Do you have specific reasons to start improving your finances right now?
options: 🏡 I want to save for a big goal, like buying a home or car
🛫 I want more travel and experiences without stress
🎓 I need to handle student loans or plan for further education
👪 I want to provide a better future for my family
💼 I’m focused on building wealth or preparing for retirement
🔄 My situation is unique, but I know it’s time for a change

questions.question: 🌦 How would you describe your current financial situation?
options: ⛈ Overwhelming—I’m struggling to keep up.
🌧 Uncertain—I often feel lost or unsure.
🌤 Okay—I’m managing but not growing much.
🌞 Stable and improving—I’m making progress.
🌈 Hopeful—I’m quite good and improving over time.

questions.question: 🚀 If you could change one thing about your finances today, what would it be?
options: 💳 Eliminate debt.
💰 Save more for the future.
🤔 Understand my financial habits better.
🔄 Learn how to set and stick to financial goals.

experiences.question: Are you motivated to change your financial life for the better?
Can you dedicate at least 5 minutes a day to start a totally new financial chapter and build the life you've envisioned?
Are you ready to start improving your financial skills today?
